Package org.forgerock.openam.wsfederation.common

Class ActiveRequestorException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • com.sun.identity.shared.locale.L10NMessageImpl
          • com.sun.identity.wsfederation.common.WSFederationException
            • org.forgerock.openam.wsfederation.common.ActiveRequestorException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    L10NMessage, Serializable
    public class ActiveRequestorException
extends WSFederationException
    A WSFederationException type that specifically handles error situations corresponding to WS-Federation Active Requestor Profile.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • newSenderException

        public static ActiveRequestorException newSenderException​(String key,
                                                          String... args)
        Constructs a new exception instance for client side errors.
        Parameters:
        key - The localization key to use when constructing the SOAP fault.
        args - Additional parameters for the localized message.
        Returns:
        An exception instance which represents the error state.

      • newReceiverException

        Constructs a new exception instance for server side errors.

        args - Additional parameters for the localized message.

      • newReceiverException

        public static ActiveRequestorException newReceiverException​(Throwable throwable)
        Constructs a new exception instance for server side errors based on exception objects.
        Parameters:
        throwable - The exception that should be encapsulated in the error message.
        Returns:
        An exception instance which represents the error state.

      • getSOAPFault

        public jakarta.xml.soap.SOAPMessage getSOAPFault()
        Returns the exception's SOAP Fault representation that can be returned back to the SOAP client as a response.
        Returns:
        The exception's SOAP Fault representation. May return null, if there was a problem while creating the SOAP objects.
